p: According to the Ph. Eur. X definition, thyme herb is described as whole leaves and flowers separated from the dried stems of T. vulgaris or T. zygis or their mixture with 12 mL/kg of minimum essential oil (EO) and minimum thymol and carvacrol contents of 40% [ 2]. Thyme EO is defined as a product of the steam distillation of fresh flowering aerial parts of one or a mixture of both species with 37–55% thymol and 0.5–5.5% carvacrol concentrations [ 2, 3].
